meanings.definition: To prevent something from happening or succeeding.
meanings.sent1: She was scuppering his plans by revealing the surprise party.
meanings.sent2: The heavy rain was scuppering their outdoor picnic.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel scuppered the bird's attempt to steal its nuts.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected snowstorm scuppered their hopes for a sunny day at the beach.
meanings.sent5: The faulty engine scuppered their chances of winning the race.

meanings.definition: The act of causing something to fail or be ruined.
meanings.sent1: The scuppering of their project was a major setback.
meanings.sent2: He blamed the scuppering of his career on his own mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The scuppering of the cake was a result of using salt instead of sugar.
meanings.sent4: The scuppering of their relationship was inevitable due to constant misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: The scuppering of the mission was a blow to their team's morale.
